contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox U.S. County |county = Calhoun County |state = South Carolina |seal = |map = Map of South Carolina highlighting Calhoun County.png |map size = 200 |founded = 1908 |named for = [[John C. Calhoun]] |seat = [[St. Matthews, South Carolina|St. Matthews]] |area_total_sq_mi =392 |area_land_sq_mi =380 |area_water_sq_mi =12 |area percentage = 3.09% |census yr = 2010 |pop = 15175 |density_km2 =15.4 |web = www.calhouncounty.sc.gov }} '''Calhoun County''' is a [[County (US)|county]] located in the [[U.S. state]] of [[South Carolina]]. As of the [[2010 United States Census|2010 census]], its population was 15,175.<ref>{{cite web|last=United States Census Bureau|title=2010 Census Data|url=http://2010.census.gov/2010census/data/|publisher=United States Census Bureau|accessdate=23 January 2012}}</ref> It is named for [[John C. Calhoun]], the former U.S. Vice-President, Senator, Representative and cabinet member from South Carolina. It was formed in 1908 from portions of Lexington and Orangeburg counties. Its [[county seat]] is [[St. Matthews, South Carolina|St. Matthews]].{{GR|6}} Calhoun County is part of the [[Columbia, South Carolina]], [[Columbia, South Carolina metropolitan area|Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. ==Geography== According to the [[United States Census Bureau|U.S. Census Bureau]], the county has a total area of {{convert|392|sqmi|1}}, the smallest county in South Carolina, of which {{convert|380|sqmi|1}} is land and {{convert|12|sqmi|1}} (3.09%) is water. ===Adjacent counties=== *[[Richland County, South Carolina]] - north *[[Sumter County, South Carolina]] - northeast *[[Clarendon County, South Carolina]] - east *[[Orangeburg County, South Carolina]] - south *[[Lexington County, South Carolina]] - northwest ==Demographics== {{USCensusPop |1910= 16634 |1920= 18384 |1930= 16707 |1940= 16229 |1950= 14753 |1960= 12256 |1970= 10780 |1980= 12206 |1990= 12753 |2000= 15185 |2010= 15175 |footnote=<center>[http://www.census.gov/prod/www/abs/decennial/ U.S. Decennial Census]</center> }} As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 15,185 people, 5,917 households, and 4,272 families residing in the county. The [[population density]] was 40 people per square mile (15/km²). There were 6,864 housing units at an average density of 18 per square mile (7/km²). The racial makeup of the county was 50.03% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 48.69% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.19% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.14% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.03% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.24% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 0.69% from two or more races. 1.40% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race. There were 5,917 households out of which 30.20% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 52.00% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 15.80% had a female householder with no husband present, and 27.80% were non-families. 24.50% of all households were made up of individuals and 9.60% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.54 and the average family size was 3.03. In the county, the population was spread out with 25.10% under the age of 18, 7.40% from 18 to 24, 27.00% from 25 to 44, 26.70% from 45 to 64, and 13.80% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 39 years. For every 100 females there were 90.10 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 86.40 males. The median income for a household in the county was $32,736, and the median income for a family was $39,823. Males had a median income of $31,431 versus $22,267 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the county was $17,446. About 13.20% of families and 16.20% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 20.40% of those under age 18 and 18.30% of those age 65 or over. ==Cities and towns== *[[Cameron, South Carolina|Cameron]] *[[Creston, South Carolina|Creston]] *[[Fort Motte, South Carolina|Fort Motte]] *[[Lone Star, South Carolina|Lone Star]] *[[St. Matthews, South Carolina|St. Matthews]] *[[Sandy Run, South Carolina|Sandy Run]] ==See also== * [[Lake Marion (South Carolina)|Lake Marion]] *[[National Register of Historic Places listings in Calhoun County, South Carolina]] ==External links== *[http://www.calhouncounty.sc.gov/ Calhoun County website] ==References== <references/> {{Calhoun County, South Carolina}} {{South Carolina}} {{coord|33.67|-80.78|display=title|type:adm2nd_region:US-SC_source:UScensus1990}} [[Category:Calhoun County, South Carolina| ]] [[Category:1908 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:South Carolina counties]] [[Category:Columbia, South Carolina metropolitan area]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1908]]
